newsitem.title: JAPAN: MOF to allow banks to issue straight bonds--paper.
newsitem.headline: MOF to allow banks to issue straight bonds--paper.

text.p: Japan's Ministry of Finance (MOF) plans to allow commercial banks to issue straight bonds starting as early as the year from next April 1, a Japanese business daily said on Friday.
The move follows a decision by an advisory panel to the finance minister on Thursday that banks should be allowed to issue straight bonds, the Nihon Keizai Shimbun said.

The panel also recommended that bank debentures, which are now issued only by a limited number of financial institutions, including long-term credit banks, should be abolished in the future, the paper said.

Currently, commercial banks are not allowed to issue straight bonds and only the Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi Ltd is allowed to issue debentures. Commercial banks are nationwide city banks and regional banks.
Neither MOF nor the panel were immediately available for comment.
